content: The Second Amendment exists to ensure the security and protection of the rest of the Constitution and Bill of Rights. 'Rights' are not 'given or granted or permitted' by government. Rights are inalienable. Rights are either recognized and protected by government or denied. All of these agenda driven politicians (and most of us) took the oath to Support and Defend the Constitution (all of it). They do not. Those of you who live and work in those areas which deny the Right to self defense endure tyranny. Some of you were born into that culture (as I was) where the right has been denied or tampered with for so long it's 'normal'. You have been inculcated/indoctrinated with propaganda from both the government and the running dog media that firearms are evil. That firearms are only to be held by the 'Police' and 'Military'. Neither of which have any duty to protect the individual. The media automatically screams 'Wild West' alarms whenever those areas previously restricting or forbidding the free exercise of the Right finally abide by the Constitution. "There will be shoot-outs in the streets!!!!" It doesn't happen. This is merely alarmist projection. Alaska and New Hampshire abide by 'Constitutional Carry'. No permits or such to bear arms either openly or concealed. The media never mentions that. Amazing how many people are completely ignorant of their own State's gun rights. No amount of legislation will control criminal behaviour. Denial of citizen's rights to self defense... particularly with 'Gun Free Zones' ensures a free ride for anyone with criminal intent w/o fear of armed resistance. Yet... the sheep willl continue to huddle and bleat in unison when they are attacked... unwilling or unable to defend themselves.

content: Personally, I have known police "officers" who admitted they joined the force because it was the only gang they could get into. They can stay out all night, go crusing, and have "fun." I was with my brother in law one night(he was working grave shift for a police tow company) when we ran into a bunch of cars cruising. I was looking to my right when all of a sudden I heard the roar of a motorcycle, I looked forward and the damn thing look like it was coming into the windshield. The idiot crashed into the front of the truck and ended up under the front end. We rushed out side to be greeted by a badge, "Is there a problem?" Some random guy walked up and said "I don't give a **** who you are." The look on the cops face was priceless because he was screwed either way....The guy took the keys out of the bike and kept them away from the so-called cop...lol Eventually the highway patrol handled the situation, and presumably that individuals violation of public trust.

It is to maintain a superior position vis-a-vis the rest of the population. It isn't about "officer safety", it's about control. Personally, I think any chief LEO that campaigns against gun rights should be stripped of his position on the spot. Unfortunately, in too many states, the citizens are more than willing to accept an oppressive police state in a misguided sense of safety. I won't argue that some cops are real *******s - I know some of the cops where I grew up, and they could all point to the guys on the force who got into the business so they could beat up on people "legally". Most of those guys gravitate to the night shift - more action, and drunks are less likely to fight back or press charges. But most of the rest don't like armed civilians either. Nothing about power in it - they just don't want to get shot. They never know if the guy with the 9mm is a drug dealer, a cult member, someone looking for "suicide by cop", or someone just trying to protect themself. They never know if that person is looking to take a shot at them. Make them nervous. One of the guys I knew (family friend, my old cubmaster from when I was a kid) was nearly killed by a homeowner - he was responding to a home invasion report, guy decided that the burgler had come back (apparently missing the flashing lights) and decided to shoot first and skip the questions. Luckily he was a bad shot.

content: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: quote: Originally posted by Hoffy1951: Why do you need a weapon, anyhoo? You're just a run-of-the-mill tax lawyer in the Tacoma area... If you need a weapon that bad...see my 3d cousin...he's a Sergeant with the PCSO and works at the City-County Building in Tacoma Why would I want to see your cousin? What would he know, he's a cop. Its ironic, the police are actually making us less safe by railing against gun rights...By denying our right to carry concealed weapons they are making us more vulnerable to horrible crimes... No crime = No over time Anytime I have been pulled over, I tell the officer I have a gun and it's loaded. I tell them where it is and all. They have ALWAYS been polite, yes they take it out, unload and and leave the upper reciever locked to the rear until they are done with their "processing." Then they reload it the way I had it and thank me for disclosing the information. Then they let me go on my way. If you ask me, they seemed very satisfied with the way I handled the situation. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin

content: Personally, I have known police "officers" who admitted they joined the force because it was the only gang they could get into. They can stay out all night, go crusing, and have "fun." I was with my brother in law one night(he was working grave shift for a police tow company) when we ran into a bunch of cars cruising. I was looking to my right when all of a sudden I heard the roar of a motorcycle, I looked forward and the damn thing look like it was coming into the windshield. The idiot crashed into the front of the truck and ended up under the front end. We rushed out side to be greeted by a badge, "Is there a problem?" Some random guy walked up and said "I don't give a **** who you are." The look on the cops face was priceless because he was screwed either way....The guy took the keys out of the bike and kept them away from the so-called cop...lol Eventually the highway patrol handled the situation, and presumably that individuals violation of public trust.

content: quote: Originally posted by RoofRatOrdie: The Second Amendment exists to ensure the security and protection of the rest of the Constitution and Bill of Rights. 'Rights' are not 'given or granted or permitted' by government. Rights are inalienable. Rights are either recognized and protected by government or denied. All of these agenda driven politicians (and most of us) took the oath to Support and Defend the Constitution (all of it). They do not. Those of you who live and work in those areas which deny the Right to self defense endure tyranny. Some of you were born into that culture (as I was) where the right has been denied or tampered with for so long it's 'normal'. You have been inculcated/indoctrinated with propaganda from both the government and the running dog media that firearms are evil. That firearms are only to be held by the 'Police' and 'Military'. Neither of which have any duty to protect the individual. The media automatically screams 'Wild West' alarms whenever those areas previously restricting or forbidding the free exercise of the Right finally abide by the Constitution. "There will be shoot-outs in the streets!!!!" It doesn't happen. This is merely alarmist projection. Alaska and New Hampshire abide by 'Constitutional Carry'. No permits or such to bear arms either openly or concealed. The media never mentions that. Amazing how many people are completely ignorant of their own State's gun rights. No amount of legislation will control criminal behaviour. Denial of citizen's rights to self defense... particularly with 'Gun Free Zones' ensures a free ride for anyone with criminal intent w/o fear of armed resistance. Yet... the sheep willl continue to huddle and bleat in unison when they are attacked... unwilling or unable to defend themselves. Well said Sir!
